website_summaries.verdict: This sleek, modern toaster will add a touch of elegance to your kitchen counter and delivers evenly brown toast every time.
pros: Extra-wide slots to hold bagels and thicker breads
A Bit More, Lift and Look, defrost and bagel settings
5-setting browning control with LED progress indicator
Beeps at the end of cycle
cons: There have been a few instances of bread getting stuck down in the toaster

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 6 days
customer_reviews.text: I really expected this expensive toaster to be perfect, especially since it was a Breville. On the 6th day, after removing two toasted slices of bread, all the lights started flashing. We unplugged it, waited until the following morning, tried it again to no luck. Lights keep flashing and it makes a repetitive ticking noise. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Out of the Box it doesn’t work!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my fancy toaster today. I ran one toast cycle without bread, as directed, to get rid of smell. Okay. But now it won’t work. Just that fast, it’s not working. $125 for a toaster that doesn’t work. Called customer service and there’s a 35 minute wait time. Used call back option and now I wait. What a complete joke. The automatic lift won’t raise. I get a bunch of white lights and no button works. I got a call back from Breville. Here’s another issue. There is no serial number on the toaster. What’s up with that, Amazon??? I’d like a toaster with a serial number, please. toast day
customer_reviews.author: TrishScott

customer_reviews.title: Money for nothing
customer_reviews.text: No toaster should break down after only 2-3 weeks of moderate use - especially one this expensive. Well, this one did. The mechanism that brings the bread down and lifts it back up malfunctioned after toasting a bagel, so I had to fish the bagel out manually (power off, of course). Technical support at Breville had me turn the toaster upside down and shake it a couple of times, but that did no good. So they offered to replace it. There is nothing so special about this toaster that I felt I had to have another one just like it. So, back it went. Too bad, though, it looked quite nice on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Zabarkes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all right out of the box. ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work at all right out of the box. We followed all of the instructions for the initial setup, and it jammed on the first try. And on the first try where it says to run it empty to burn off any shipping debris it didn't beep when complete. We tried changing the volume per instructions but to no avail. It was promptly returned with the aforementioned jammed piece of toast still inside.
customer_reviews.author: CptT

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it so far
customer_reviews.text: I read toaster reviews until I couldn't stand it anymore. Every toaster has basically the same set of reviews - 75% 5 stars, 20% 1 star, and a smattering of 2 - 4 stars. Some worse than others... I just kept telling myself - "it's a toaster, how GREAT can it be?". Well.. finally I decided to just go for it and get the one that Amazon suggested. REALLY glad I did! This toaster is GREAT! Sure, it is cool that it is automatic and all.. but there is a difference in the quality of toast. Time will tell if it is durable or not. But ultimately, I am really glad I bought this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Powers

customer_reviews.title: Unsuccessful Breville digital toaster
customer_reviews.text: The Breville 2 slice toaster is an overpriced digital kitchen decoration. The one I purchased as a gift stopped working after 4 months. Breville replaced it with a new one that toasts one side of the bread darker than the other. The user manual is confusing and has no section on trouble shooting. Difficult to reach anyone at Breville by phone. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne E. Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: I love the features and quality
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it is kind of expensive for a toaster and no doubt a $15 toaster can make the exact same toast. But I didn't mind spending the money for the die-cast construction and features. It has the functionality of a good, proper kitchen appliance. I love the digital functions like adding a little more time and peaking at the toast. I haven't used it for bagels yet, but I do like that it will toast the inside a little more than the outside. It is very easy to clean. And it looks nice on the countertop. I used to keep the old one tucked away because it looked rickety. I do like it quite a lot.
customer_reviews.author: OMEvans

customer_reviews.title: Less than two months and the toaster quite working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 8/7/19, failed to work on 9/28/19. On 9/28/19, when attempting to turn on the toaster it triggered the Ground Fault Interrupter Circuit (GFIC). I tried three other out-lets on separate GFIC circuits and the same GFIC failure happened. From what I can tell,,,this GFIC trigger means that the toaster presented an electrical shock hazard or some other electrical short-circuit hazard that triggered the GFIC. None the less, the toaster has failed to work after less than 2 months. Buyer be ware !
customer_reviews.author: Ezekel 46

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this did not live up to the great reviews. It toasted unevenly and the toast would not come back up. Had to unplug and leave overnight before it worked the next day. I thought it might be because I got it used from the Amazon warehouse, but in researching all the reviews these are common complains. Rather than purchase a new one I'm returning and buying a Cuisinart instead.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster, poor reliability.  Suspect amateur hour firmware design and or cheap componentry.
customer_reviews.text: Works reasonably well, the bit more button is very useful. Toasting was not as uniform as it could have been, seems like the upper elements were cooler than the lower ones. Unacceptable problem is reliability, had to reset the logic several times as the toaster got into infinite loops several times, and now cannot get the inner side burners to heat. This one lasted about 3 months, was a replacement for the same model that lasted longer, but no longer can go with this model. Whomever writes their firmware or designs their logic boards needs to go back to school
customer_reviews.author: MrPontePreta

customer_reviews.title: Not one piece of toast cooked!  A true disaster.
customer_reviews.text: A good brand I've had great experiences with for other kitchen appliances, including an espresso maker. However, one requirement I have in a toaster is that it actually toasts BOTH sides of the bread. I followed their odd break in instructions after trying one piece and having a problem. No help. Customer service line had no good ideas. Regular setting - only two coils turn on, except at settings so high it would burn the toast to a crisp. Even then, extremely uneven. Bagel setting maybe? Nope, that just switched which two coils worked, opposite of the regular setting. So, a nice piece of heavy metal junk. Into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: It toasts
customer_reviews.text: The slots are sized generously to fit various types of bread and it toasts more or less evenly. Has no problem getting toast light or dark, and back to back batches come out pretty consistent. I've owned mine for 5 years now without any problems. I was worried when we bought it that the automatic raising/lowering mechanism would break after a short time, but it's still going strong. Would I buy it again? I dunno, maybe. It's a lovely toaster, but this is a lot of $$ for a simple, low tech appliance. It sure does look good on the counter though.
customer_reviews.author: Arrr

customer_reviews.title: We have two of these Breville toasters. Both are malfunctioning.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these toasters. Have used them perhaps 15 times. Both are malfunctioning. Same malfunction: Bread tray stays down and will not rise, wire are that should open and close stay closed, all lights flashing and do not stop. Called Breville for advice. Was told to unplug the unit for 30-45 minutes so it could "reset". What a joke. Still malfunctioning. DO NOT BUY. We intend to send them back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Failed after less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I should expect this with appliances in this day and age but just thought Breville might be in a different class of product. At about 2 years and 9 months the toaster started toasting only one side of the bread (both slots). Taken very good care of it. Cleaned regularly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Decided to splurge on this toaster and happy I did
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a shopper who buys the $19.99 kitchen appliances. Well after about my 3rd toaster I was tired of how crappy my toast would come out, half done. After reading the reviews I decided to splurge on this toaster. I'm really glad I did because my whole family has commented on how much they like the toaster. It has many functions I wasn't sure I needed but after using it I've found I really enjoy them. The details on the toaster thoughtfully designed, for example, the plug-in is designed larger and easier to remove. Why aren't they all designed like this? Splurge and get this toaster!
customer_reviews.author: pdxjo

customer_reviews.title: Software bugs.  Its never been so difficult to get toast.
customer_reviews.text: Major software bugs. Consistently needs to be unplugged and replugged multiple times to reset. Unless you enjoy turning the toaster upside down to retrieve your toast - do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Price

customer_reviews.title: The last toaster you will buy!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing the best consummer reports toasters for about 4 years in a row and getting toasters that made cracker bread, or warm bread, I ordered this toaster. We have had it over 5 years and have had nothing but perfect toast from bagels to anything else that fits!. If you buy this toaster it should be the last one you buy. Not only do you get perfect toast but a beautiful toaster that is very easy to clean. My husband uses it every day and it still looks new!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Marmar

customer_reviews.title: $125 for a toaster that doesn't properly toast!
customer_reviews.text: Our latest Breville toaster is a handsome, expensive piece of junk. It arrived and the heating implements didn't work, or they kind of worked in a way that burned one side of the bread and didn't toast the other side at all. We loved our first Breville toaster, which lasted four years. We liked our second Breville toaster that lasted two years. Our third Breville toaster was dead on arrival, and we are returning.
customer_reviews.author: John Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to love this toaster. I splurged on it for making toast with my homemade freshly ground kamut sour dough bread. The toaster feels sturdy out of the box, but most days we get a very disappointing, uneven toast. The top part of the bread often burns. I'm very disappointed with this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted about a week and then started acting up- having all the lights flash at one time and the toaster freezing up and locking in the down position. We had to unplug it, and wait for it to reset the next day. We thought it was a fluke until it started happening more and then after a few months, it literally locked up on us and never was able to get reset so the toaster was locked in the closed down position and now I can't use it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Richmon

customer_reviews.title: 2 Have Malfunctioned!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one and it has malfunctioned again! The last thing we need is an overly “smart” toaster that either gets toast stuck or won’t fully turn off after toasting. It’s not safe. So much for price equaling quality. It’s hard to grade material quality fairly, by the way, if it just decides to not work. Wish we could return again and get something different but I think it’s too late. :(
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M. Brudvig

customer_reviews.title: Not as Robust as You Would Expect.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love this toaster. Has a real quality feel to it and not having a lift lever is a really cool thing in a toaster. Third time I used it it got stuck and would not raise the toast. Kept making noise like it was trying but a breaker kept kicking out. The Breville folks were really nice. Eventually someone said that if it gets a crumb of toast in the wrong place the mechanism cannot handle it. Take from that what you will. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ken King

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 Years Product Life
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster for 3.5 years and it's dead. As a household of 1, with low use of this toaster, I am disappointed that the product has failed already. One day it just stopped working. The lights come on, but it will not lower the bread trays down and the heating elements do not light. Very poor quality for the hefty price I paid for this toaster. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toaster until it stopped working after 2 years of use. I had hoped paying a premium for a toaster would be a sound investment. I had cheap toasters that lasted much longer. The problem is middle elements stopped working and only tiasts on one side. Bummer... Will not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Way

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toast every time
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster! Taking my cue from the product name, I opted to use it to toast bread and bread-like products. It turns out that was the perfect choice. This toaster automatically lowers the toast. No more strained and sprained fingers and wrists from having to manually depress a lever just to get your bread into position for toasting. Further, the appliance has a countdown timer to let you know when your toast is approaching your selected degree of doneness. Finally, the toaster has a brain so each slice is done exactly as the one before.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Hoh

customer_reviews.title: GOOD WHILE IT LASTED
customer_reviews.text: We really liked this toaster, unfortunately after 15 months of daily use it began tripping the GFI outlet and then died. We've had $20 big-box toasters last longer than this; there is no way I can recommend this one, so do yourself a favor, save some money and aggravation and buy something else.......you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Yes, its cost twice as much as a good toaster. But it's three times as good. It toasts everything evenly. I love how it grabs and centers what you put in. It works on 1 slice just as well as 2. It does toast, English muffins and bagels beautifully. It feels really solid and looks stunning. I have this in my winter home and got one for my summer home immediately. So if you use a toaster often and want a life long treat, get this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ed OB

customer_reviews.title: This has been a very dependable toaster, up till now.....
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toaster back in 2017 and have been very pleased with the looks and toasting ability of the product. Unfortunately, it has gone on the blitz. The electronics have essentially gone haywire. The lights stay on even after unplugging in an attempt to reset it, and you have to check it manually to pop up the toast. Of course this is after the warranty has run out, so some frustration there. I am considering buying another one, but this time will likely get the extended warranty. But its a shame that you have to buy an extended warranty for a toaster, after all isn't it really just browning bread?
customer_reviews.author: Jon Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Failed like so many of the other reviews. The carriage gets stuck down and rebooting by unplugging works after several minutes. Horrific quality in their software is what it appears to be.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: heating element are terrible
customer_reviews.text: The heating elements heat everything unevenly. one side of bread is always lighter. I returned the first one I receved for the same reason and the replacement toaster is doing the same.
customer_reviews.author: JEROME M.

customer_reviews.title: First toaster sent did not work
customer_reviews.text: The first toaster shipped to me would not lower or raise toast. It was royal pain to return to breville and get a new one. The new one works fine. I had exact same one before and it worked fine for 8 years and then it only toasted on one side. I love the toaster for its solid feel and elegance. Works well but pretty expensive for a toaster!
customer_reviews.author: sonya

customer_reviews.title: Fun features
customer_reviews.text: I find this toaster to be an attractive appliance that can stay out on the counter. It has several fun features that I have never seen before. Instead of pushing a lever to start toasting the bread you just push a button on top and watch it disappear and then slowly rise after the cycle is complete. I love the buttons: a bit more, take a peek and frozen. The only takeaway is that it does not toast both sides evenly (common with toasters) but I just flip it over and hit the "a bit more" button. It's an easy solve and worth the small inconvenience in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: STANLEY REED

customer_reviews.title: Keep your old toaster.
customer_reviews.text: This toaster does not do the job. One side comes out nice the other not done. I sent the first one back because of this and was sent another one. It does the same thing. I wish that I had not given my old one away. The reason that I gave it one star is that it looks great. To bad it does not do its job of being a toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mom

customer_reviews.title: All are excellent. I not only toast bread as a normal ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Breville product. All are excellent. I not only toast bread as a normal person would in the Breville, but also frozen waffles. The degree of control like on all Breville products is excellent. This product comes from Australia and I have wondered at times why America prefers to sell inferior devices that fail or do not perform in the range that a Breville does. I have the Toaster Oven which I use in lieu of the the large oven over 90%. Also my Breville Grill not only delivers a fine steak or hamburger but grilling salmon is outstanding. I recommend any of the three Breville devices without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert OMalley

customer_reviews.title: Some things just shouldn’t be automated
customer_reviews.text: The toaster started off great but within days it got stuck with the toast down and made a clicking noise. Unplugging for a long period of time and once it cooled down, replugging it in, it’d work just fine again. From the outside it’s a great toaster and toasts well but there obviously wasn’t enough development put into this because the tiny motors can’t keep up with jamming constantly. Would not recommend this toaster to anyone who wants a long term toaster that works every time
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Coxen

customer_reviews.title: Bad amazon guarantee for quality/defects
customer_reviews.text: Loved this toaster while it worked BUT it has an irreparable defect and stopped working at 6 weeks (with very light use). I am now Outside of amazon return window. I will NOT be purchasing home electronics on amazon in future or this toaster
customer_reviews.author: LESLEE L. SUBAK,MD

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 14 months on a 1 year warranty -- why couldn't it have died earlier!
customer_reviews.text: It's simply amazing how often things die just weeks/months out of warranty. Paid an arm and a leg for this toaster (as far as toasters go); would have expected it to last longer. Have had issues with the Breville blender as well so this will be the last Breville we own. They look great, but seems like they've mastered planned obsolescence.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kirchner

customer_reviews.title: Four Year Review
customer_reviews.text: We've had this toaster for 4 years now. It's every weekend and some weekdays. To date, it's performed just as it should. I toasted a bagel while typing this and it came out perfect. There will be a little trial and error to find your "perfect" toast but for me and my wife, it has worked great and would gladly purchase it again if it ever failed.
customer_reviews.author: devcon

customer_reviews.title: Today is February 26 and my toaster is not toasting ...
customer_reviews.text: Today is February 26 and my toaster is not toasting. All the lights are going on and off continuously. There is no heat inside the cavities. This is si disappointing—2 months ols.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster ever, but dead after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: This really toasts perfectly. So perfectly, the price seemed worth it. The electronics went out once- blinking lights and not toasting, but it came back to life. This time it has not come back. I ordered it exactly 18 months ago. So you decide if perfect toast is worth $7+/ month.
customer_reviews.author: Brrrlington

customer_reviews.title: Two Defective Nearly Immediately
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I got toasted about 5 times then jammed and would not raise the slots, all lights flashing. Returned to Amazon the second one cycled just once (without any toast) then on the next no-toast try it jammed in the same way. Called Breville they told me to give it a whack on the sides, that didn't work then they told me to return it. Breville return not up to Amazon standards, they will ship when they get the return unit. SAD
customer_reviews.author: RonSF

customer_reviews.title: Toasts evenly with a removable crumb tray.
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this toaster. He has gone through so many toasters that burn it on one side, only toast part of the toast, get stuck in the toaster, etc. He cannot start his morning without toast. This toaster was a little spendy (we bought an extended warranty), but he will say it was worth it. It toasts very evenly, the slots are wide, and you can press a button mid cycle to take a look at its progress. The crumb tray can be emptied, which is a big plus. We love the brushed stainless exterior; very expensive looking. It goes well with our stainless appliances.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schulz

customer_reviews.title: This is the WORST toaster ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST toaster ever! If you grew up with traditional toasters like me (I still have my parents GE toaster from 1947 they received as a wedding gift - still works) you'll find that this toaster takes way too long to make toast. As a result, when toasting is finally complete, the toast is completely dried out and is far too crunchy for my taste. I didn't try it with other items, just toast. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: 2nd failure in three years
customer_reviews.text: All we buy is Breville. Most of their products are worth the cost compared to others. This toaster, however, is an exception. We've had tewo of these that simply stop toasting then eventually pop the GFCI circuits. Although I'm a fan of BrevilIe, we can't recommend this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Smudgy1

customer_reviews.title: Very uneven toasting, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Despite the usual mix of glowing and hating reviews, I took the chance on finally getting a toaster that could do the fundamental job of just evenly toasting a piece of bread. Alas, it isn't this one. I tried both sides of the toaster, one side comes out too brown at the top and barely toasted at the bottom with the other side evenly but insufficiently toasted. This performed worse than the Black and Decker I just tossed after many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: We all love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: We all love this toaster. It actually toasts bread on one go. Our old cheapie took a couple of "pushes" on the handle. I love my breville smart oven, so I thought I'd try the toaster. I'm very glad that I did. My children love using it ! You push a button to lower the bread, and there is button to check on the colour of your toast.....no more guessing. It seems well made, no issues in six months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: About as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect but about as good as a toaster can get in the world of crappy toasters. It has interesting features such as "lift and look " And "a little more", both very handy. I wish it would toast a little more evenly, but I think in this day and age this is about as good as it gets. Very sleek, sharp design, looks excellent on the counter. It's not bad enough to lower the star rating... but it's beginning to toast unevenly. The features previously listed are still great. I think most toasters nowadays are crap. This one is pretty good. I wanted it to be "the best" and "perfect"... it's not, but it's still good.
customer_reviews.author: PinkMango

customer_reviews.title: U Have to toast it twice after turning it. Raw on one side
customer_reviews.text: In a little over one month the elements on the “ inside side” of both slots stopped working, never to work again. This I have to toast it two times once on each side. This product is an overpriced piece of crapola.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Adams

customer_reviews.title: Everything but toasting
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has all the bells and whistles, which makes it fun to use. the only problem is that it has NEVER toasted my bread evenly. The most common result is a bit of toasting on about an inch at the top of one side of the slice and nothing on the other side. Recently the top has been neglected in favor of toasting along one edge, again on one side of the bread only. Very expensive unsatisfactory toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is a major disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a major disappointment! It does not toast evenly at all. Some spots are burned while other spots aren't toasted at all. I expected better performance from Breville and here I am, only six months after purchasing it, needing to buy another new toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Roth

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about some negative reviews here. Some were quite scary. I do however have a coffee maker and a waffle maker by Breville that have been very reliable and of superior quality. I’ve had the toaster for few weeks now and do not regret a bit. Even if it breaks I’ll still get the same toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzkin

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these toasters about a year ago and loved it. I bought my son and his family one for Christmas. What a hit! Now their 6 years old can actually make her own toast and waffles easily. She loves to watch the light on the front move as the toasting cycle proceeds. She also enjoys "checking" the waffle prior to completion. A great addition to any family.
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Toasters are overrated. Buy a versatile toaster oven.
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT toast evenly on both sides. We had it for 6 months hoping we would figure out a good setting. We finally bought a small toaster oven, which we make so many more things with, including toast.
customer_reviews.author: babycakes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Overall this Breville toaster has nice features, and it's easy to use. Bread slices are held tightly in the middle and not flopping to one side or the other, resulting in more even toasting. It has a "Bit More" button for when you want just a little more toasting. There may not be a toaster that makes perfect toast, but this one comes pretty close.
customer_reviews.author: 24Spring

customer_reviews.title: Great toasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to replace an older Viking toaster that's starting to loose it's "oomph". So far, I like the Breville a lot. It's well-made, simple to use, works quickly - and best of all, it makes wonderful and evenly browned toast. The electronic lift works well, as do the various settings - definitely does everything a quality toaster should do. About my only gripe is that the power cord is a bit large (it's ugly poking out behind the toaster) and the walls of the toaster get a bit too hot for my liking, especially when using the toaster several times in succession. Worth a try if you're looking for a top quality toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Executive

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced but it's the first toaster I've had in years which toasts evenly no matter what you put in it. The control slide lights up so you can easily see where you want to set it for perfect toast every time. Love that there's a touch control for "just a bit more". No more burning the toast because it was too light the first time. Also when doing several slices, it seems to compensate somehow and the last slice is no browner than the first. It has a beeper like everything else these days. Too much noise pollution in the kitchen when the rest are trying to sleep. I really don't need my toaster to beep also.
customer_reviews.author: LHB

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality. Unexpectedly, it is fun to use. It does everything well from bread to bagels, English muffins and frozen treats. This is a relatively expensive toaster but it is the best out there. I would buy it again. You should too. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mallagator

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT RECALL DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: Sadly we experienced a burn out of the unit resulting in a kitchen fire. We will notify authorities of the danger. PLEASE be careful if you have this unit or are thinking of buying.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but excellent toaster
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Toasters are always a worrisome product to buy, as even the best manufacturers seem to produce a lot of lemons. This Breville has proved to be solid over a period of several months now. It was bigger than I expected, but the casing does provide excellent insulation from the hot core. The electronic controls have been working well. The slots are a generous size. The toasting results are fairly even. The bagel feature works as expected. My only complaint is that baguette slices can topple over when they're being raised, and they can catch on the ends of the slots, causing a jam.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Every time my husband uses this toaster he talks about how much he loves it, and he never notices anything! It’s great looking and does a great job. I love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Guadarrama

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster!! I was reluctant to spend that much money on a toaster (it only toasts bread, after all!!) but we're quite pleased with it. Even my wife who thought I was crazy, delights in using it. Thus far no problems of any sort.
customer_reviews.author: Quilting Gal

customer_reviews.title: Quality toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster I have ever bought. It's expensive but well worth the price. It has so many great features from checking your bread mid toast, a little more button and a frozen bread button.
customer_reviews.author: Juli

customer_reviews.title: Breville toaster
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Breville on June 1 2017. After about 1 year and 10 months half of the electric coils in the toaster are out. This results in a very long time to toast anything and the toasting is uneven. It has a 1 year warrant.
customer_reviews.author: David j Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toaster that is not a disappointment.  I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toaster that is not a disappointment. I've had this a month and so far I could not ask for a better performance, and I am known for being hard to please. Artisan bread, artisan bagels, hamburger buns, and hot dog buns have been near perfect. The toasting is constant every time. So far my bread always comes up perfect without getting stuck. It is clean looking and compact. I an not one for bells and whistles but the controls are great. I actually get to participate in how the toast is made instead of waiting just to see how it comes out. I am no spring bird, I've had about eight toasters over many years
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dye

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster Ever
customer_reviews.text: I need more stars!! This is a fabulous toaster, very solid and well-made. I read A LOT of reviews before deciding on this one, and I'm so glad I did--it performs exactly as stated in the ad, has enough features to be useful without looking like a prop from Star Trek, and is quietly attractive on my counter. I will look into other Breville appliances as I need new ones!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley M.

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Toast
customer_reviews.text: All my friends think I'm boujee because I have this toaster. I mean, they aren't wrong. It's expensive, but you get what you pay for. You don't even have to manually press your bread down like all the other peasants. You just push a button and it goes down. It also lights up to let you know how much time you have left. V convenient. V sleek. I've had it for a year and use it everyday. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best toaster ever.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a thank you gift for a friend. I have owned this model for 8 years and have gifted it twice. Both recipients have loved it. It's perfect for homemade 100% whole wheat flour bread that requires the highest setting to obtain a brown color in the toasting process. Why shouldn't I have a great toaster if I'm going through the bi-weekly effort to make my own bread? Recommended for wide-sliced bread products.
customer_reviews.author: GAIL R.

customer_reviews.title: Freezes Up
customer_reviews.text: When the toaster is performing properly is works great! I've had the toaster for only a few months and it has frozen three times in the past month. I'm unable to get the cancellation button to work and have to unplug the toast and use a tool to remove my toast. I expected more out of a this supposedly high quality toaster.
customer_reviews.author: R. Long

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfectly even toast
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little too expensive but it makes pretty good toast, and the frozen button makes crispy waffles. If it will last as long as my old made in USA toaster, I will think it is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: EcoTico

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in this toaster
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this toaster. I bought it because it received such excellent reviews in Good Housekeeping. But it toasts as though there is a bagel in it all the time. It only toasts one side of the bread.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana Chalmers

customer_reviews.title: Caution when cleaning
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to clean the outside purchase the "metal" was easily scratched. Overall great toaster but I will be returning for this reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So far, no go!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this toaster for about 1 week. It has been used maybe 10 times and now we have a malfunction. All of the lights started flashing, the bread would not come up and the unit started clicking. All of the buttons lost their functionality. Talk about poor quality. Now I have to go through the company and try to get it fixed. Read the reviews and there were a few that talked about poor quality but was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Wrong thing to do for a $150 toaster. I'll update when I get this fixed and get some mileage on the repaired unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent toaster. Have spent the past few years trying ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent toaster. Have spent the past few years trying to replace a toaster received as a shower gift 48 years ago. This is it and well worth the expense. Bread goes down quietly and comes back up quietly and the perfect toast each time. All one piece so no little areas on top for crumbs or anything to get into. Love it and highly recommend the Breville toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster EVER
customer_reviews.text: I've had way to many toasters and they are all crap even if not really cheap!! After reviewing several better brands I chose breville. It was more expensive than any toaster I have ever had but after using it I understand why. It's a GREAT product. Made very solid and love how well it wks. Hopefully it will last a long time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mycats

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster on the Market!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally!!!!! A toaster that really makes perfect toast. I didn't think one existed until I got this Breville. The toast comes out perfect even from the freezer. You can check on the progress without interrupting the cycle. And...if it just needs a little more, there's a button for that too!! I haven't tried the bagel setting yet but I'm sure it's as good. I am so tired of toasters that ruin my bread and I have tried almost every other brand from Cuisinart to Kitchen Aid. It may be pricey, but it is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: luvs2shop

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this toaster while it lasted. It no longer works, have to unplug and manually remove the bread. The warranty only good for 1 year. My next toaster will be less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie7

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster Ever
customer_reviews.text: My wife says "this is the best toaster ever". The bread comes out perfectly toasted every time. And, she finds it very easy to set and use it. However, even more important, she has not burned herself once with it. With her previous toaster, it was very easy to accidentally touch a hot part of the toaster and get a burn. The design of this toaster is such that there is good insulation all around the outside where you would typically touch the toaster. Now, instead of getting a burn when she makes toast, I keep hearing her say "this is the best toaster ever"!
customer_reviews.author: Great-Dane

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best toasters I've ever owned. Easy to use , toasts bread beautifully, lifts the bread high enough so you can easily take it out of the slots. Beautiful sitting on the counter, but also cleans up easily. Purchased a cheaper toaster, which I have now donated. Sorry I didn't buy this one to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special, it's just a toaster
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would better toast my bread.. it doesn't. If you don't have the muscle strength to push down the level, this allows a simply press of a button.. This still misses toasting on a simply piece of bread...
customer_reviews.author: Arcteryx

customer_reviews.title: Best thiing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of money to spend for a toaster but I think it's worth it. My wife thought I was nuts when I ordered this toaster, which is really nothing, new.but boy does it preform. She complained about all the buttons but I find them handy and useful, she's finally getting used to it. It does everything it's says it will and does it well. We've had it for a year and a half and it is a consistent performer. You can buy cheaper but you can't buy better..This is a quality appliance, not a cheap throw-away..
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: ... toaster for a couple of months and it works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: We've had this toaster for a couple of months and it works like a dream. My husband is no longer scraping the burnt edges off his toast ! I previously had a Sunbeam toaster that lasted for about twenty years so when it stopped working I checked the reviews for a replacement and was stunned to learn the top rated item was more than a hundred dollars! For a TOASTER ! Obviously, we bit the bullet and bought the Breville and have been very pleased with the quality, features and results.
customer_reviews.author: froggie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, a little pricey.
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had this toaster and I liked it. Thought I'd never get one but the toaster oven takes a long time to heat up to make toast and I decided it was wasting energy and my time so I went for this. It works like you'd expect and the "a little more" feature is just what you need to help get your toast perfect. It's only four stars because the price is a little crazy. It is after all just a toaster that probably cost $15 to make. But if you have a nice kitchen and/or make toast often this is a great toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Candyman

customer_reviews.title: Good Toaster
customer_reviews.text: This toaster replaced an old one that was fading (same model) The new one is hotter than the old, so is yours is replacing an older version of the same toaster, set the time for toasting a bit lower (in time) that you are used to...)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever eat a bagel without this toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Perfection for cookng a bagel! Toasts to a timer and doesn't make that scratchy pop-up sound a normal toaster makes. WORTH THE dinero. If you want to enjoy your food the way it was meant to be cooked-buy this toaster. The first time I toasted a bagel, I ate them ALL DAY-i do not know how I went my whole life without having a bagel cooked to per-FECTION! Thank you Breville.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to this toaster. Neat features like A LITTLE BIT MORE and TAKE A PEEK are cool, but the main job is give and even toast. Fails here. It either makes Nader toasts or toasts unevenly. It also has a poor design and leaves vertices lines on the toast. I think it is from the holders.
customer_reviews.author: jace anderson

customer_reviews.title: Evenly toasts
customer_reviews.text: It toasts more evenly than any toaster we have had. More money than we wanted to spend but really does a good job. Have used it on toast, frozen waffles and bakery bagels and it's worked for all of them
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Selgestad

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This toaster makes us happy! It is fun to use, toasts evenly and well, and all around makes a great start to the day. Bit of a splurge, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: Love the smart toaster
customer_reviews.text: Love the smart toaster. I have been buying special breads and like to slice them myself, thick. The button that lets you look and the a bit more button are really so helpful and easy to use. It is also a very attractive toaster. I bought the two-slice. The crumb tray works very easy and I empty mine each time I use the toaster. If you like toast, you cannot go wrong with this smart toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: the brave - i mean BEST - little toaster
customer_reviews.text: The Wirecutter said this was the best toaster and they were right. It is pricey, so perhaps not 5 stars on value, but it works great with wonderful features. My favorite is the row of lights that shows progress on toasting. You can see when it's almost done or finished, even if you didn't hear the beep. The mechanism is so quiet you don't hear the "thunk" of cheaper toasters when it's done
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, high functioning toaster
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this toaster. I have been using this toaster daily for the past two months with no issues. My only grievance is that the heating coils only heat on one side.
customer_reviews.author: Elenakimou

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Toast is very evenly toasted. Toaster operation is very quiet. Toaster only beeps once when done, which I appreciate. Beep volume can be muted, lowered, or increased. If you are looking for the perfect toaster, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Eduard Reinke

customer_reviews.title: Poor Toast Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this toaster. After spending $100 for a toaster, I expect it to toast. However even after running the toast through twice the bread is still very light. This machine is no better than toaster at much lower prices. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NYBill

customer_reviews.title: Really nice toaster..Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Have never had such a nice toaster. Looks great with the stainless appliances and works wonderful! Very Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat D

customer_reviews.title: Useless crumb tray
customer_reviews.text: It toasts nice but the crumb tray is useless..The holes to the crumb tray are so small most of the crumbs don't fall thru..They stay in the bottom of the toaster and burn . The room smells of burnt toast..The only way to fix this is to turn the toaster upside down and bang it a few times till the crumbs fall out. Definitely not worth $125
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Giuffrida

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite thing in my kitchen- and that is coming from a former professional chef. I love everything about this silly expensive toaster. I make toast just so I can use it. Best toaster ever.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Great toasters
customer_reviews.text: I like the little bit more option. The bagel option works for hamburger buns too. I like the take a look option.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Symms

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: All I want is a toaster that toasts evenly on both sides. Was even willing to spend $100+ to get it. Didn't work. Returning item. Why is this so difficult. The appliance has one job. Make a piece of toast!
customer_reviews.author: viewcaribe

customer_reviews.title: does not toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: After having spent 130 dollars and also replacing it, it is still not toasting evenly. It is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster. We bought it in Nov 2018 and enjoy the perfectly done toast. My wife enjoys bagels and this toaster does a fabulous job!
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster but did not last a week. I hade no support from the warranty At Breville till I returned the deflective toaster to Amizon. If purchasing this toaster defiantly purchase the extended warranty. I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: G S

product_meta.title: Breville BTA820XL Die-Cast 2-Slice Smart Toaster
product_meta.description: Compact 2 slice toaster. As your artisanal bread, bagel or pastry lowers gently into one of the 2 extra-wide slots, you’ll know toasting perfection is in the works. Real-world feedback led us to develop innovative 'A Bit More' and 'Lift and Look'.
feature_bullets: 900 watt 2 slice toaster with intelligent one touch auto lowering function; Voltage: 110 to 120 Volts

Push-button controls for toast, a bit more, bagel, defrost, and lift and look functions. 5 Settings including- 'A Bit More', 'Lift & Look' , Defrost & Bagel. 2 Slice Extra Wide capacity to suit all bread types
LED panel illuminates according to selected setting on variable browning control
Brushed die cast metal housing; end of cycle beep; 1-1/5 inch-wide slots; cord wrap
Dimensions- 11.25 x 7 x 7.75 inch. 1 year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,545 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
